001package squidpony.squidmath;
002
003import squidpony.StringKit;
004
005import java.io.Serializable;
006
007/**
008 * A StatefulRandomness with one {@code long} state; calling {@link #nextLong()} will produce every {@code long} exactly
009 * once before repeating. This has been backported from jdkgdxds, which got this from SquidSquad originally. It is
010 * extremely similar to {@link LightRNG}, but uses a different mixing/unary-hash function -- where LightRNG uses a
011 * variant on MurmurHash3's mixer called Variant 13, this uses Pelle Evensen's
012 * <a href="https://mostlymangling.blogspot.com/2019/12/stronger-better-morer-moremur-better.html">Moremur mixer</a>,
013 * which performs at the same (high) speed but has somewhat higher quality. This generator has a period of exactly 2 to
014 * the 64. It is a rather fast generator, particularly on Java 8 and/or OpenJ9. It has passed 64TB of PractRand testing
015 * with no anomalies. This is also a SkippingRandomness.
016 * <br>
017 * Created by Tommy Ettinger on 7/13/2021.
018 */
019public class DistinctRNG implements StatefulRandomness, SkippingRandomness, Serializable {
020    private static final long serialVersionUID = 0L;
021    /**
022     * Can be any long value.
023     */
024    public long state;
025    /**
026     * Creates a new generator seeded using Math.random.
027     */
028    public DistinctRNG() {
029        this((long) ((Math.random() - 0.5) * 0x10000000000000L)
030                ^ (long) (((Math.random() - 0.5) * 2.0) * 0x8000000000000000L));
031    }
032
033    public DistinctRNG(long seed) {
034        setSeed(seed);
035    }
036
037    /**
038     * This initializes all 3 states of the generator to random values based on the given seed.
039     * (2 to the 64) possible initial generator states can be produced here, all with a different
040     * first value returned by {@link #nextLong()} (because {@code stateA} is guaranteed to be
041     * different for every different {@code seed}).
042     * @param seed the initial seed; may be any long
043     */
044    public void setSeed(long seed) {
045        state = seed;
046    }
047
048    @Override
049    public long getState() {
050        return state;
051    }
052
053    @Override
054    public void setState(long state) {
055        this.state = state;
056    }
057
058    /**
059     * Using this method, any algorithm that might use the built-in Java Random
060     * can interface with this randomness source.
061     *
062     * @param bits the number of bits to be returned
063     * @return the integer containing the appropriate number of bits
064     */
065    @Override
066    public int next(final int bits) {
067        long x = (state += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L);
068        x ^= x >>> 27;
069        x *= 0x3C79AC492BA7B653L;
070        x ^= x >>> 33;
071        x *= 0x1C69B3F74AC4AE35L;
072        return (int)(x ^ x >>> 27) >>> (32 - bits);
073    }
074    /**
075     * Using this method, any algorithm that needs to efficiently generate more
076     * than 32 bits of random data can interface with this randomness source.
077     * <p>
078     * Get a random long between Long.MIN_VALUE and Long.MAX_VALUE (both inclusive).
079     *
080     * @return a random long between Long.MIN_VALUE and Long.MAX_VALUE (both inclusive)
081     */
082    @Override
083    public long nextLong() {
084        long x = (state += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L);
085        x ^= x >>> 27;
086        x *= 0x3C79AC492BA7B653L;
087        x ^= x >>> 33;
088        x *= 0x1C69B3F74AC4AE35L;
089        return (x ^ x >>> 27);
090    }
091
092    @Override
093    public long skip(long advance) {
094        long x = (state += 0x9E3779B97F4A7C15L * advance);
095        x ^= x >>> 27;
096        x *= 0x3C79AC492BA7B653L;
097        x ^= x >>> 33;
098        x *= 0x1C69B3F74AC4AE35L;
099        return (x ^ x >>> 27);
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Produces a copy of this RandomnessSource that, if next() and/or nextLong() are called on this object and the
104     * copy, both will generate the same sequence of random numbers from the point copy() was called. This just need to
105     * copy the state so it isn't shared, usually, and produce a new value with the same exact state.
106     *
107     * @return a copy of this RandomnessSource
108     */
109    @Override
110    public DistinctRNG copy() {
111        return new DistinctRNG(state);
112    }
113    @Override
114    public String toString() {
115        return "DistinctRNG with state 0x" + StringKit.hex(state) + 'L';
116    }
117
118    @Override
119    public boolean equals(Object o) {
120        if (this == o) return true;
121        if (o == null || getClass() != o.getClass()) return false;
122
123        DistinctRNG distinctRNG = (DistinctRNG) o;
124
125        return state == distinctRNG.state;
126    }
127
128    @Override
129    public int hashCode() {
130        return (int) (state ^ state >>> 32);
131    }
132    
133//    public static void main(String[] args)
134//    {
135//        /*
136//        cd target/classes
137//        java -XX:+UnlockDiagnosticVMOptions -XX:+PrintAssembly sarong/ThrustAltRNG > ../../thrustalt_asm.txt
138//         */
139//        long seed = 1L;
140//        ThrustAltRNG rng = new ThrustAltRNG(seed);
141//
142//        for (int i = 0; i < 1000000007; i++) {
143//            seed += rng.nextLong();
144//        }
145//        System.out.println(seed);
146//    }
147
148}
